intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. trichocephalum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, typical of the genus Hieracium. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. This subspecies is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
